remarks: A lift of a continuous function from a connected and locally connected space over a covering map is unique when it exists.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Mar-2015.)
statement:
cvmliftmo.b $e |- B = U. C $.
cvmliftmo.y $e |- Y = U. K $.
cvmliftmo.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( C CovMap J ) ) $.
cvmliftmo.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. Con ) $.
cvmliftmo.l $e |- ( ph -> K e. N-Locally Con ) $.
cvmliftmo.o $e |- ( ph -> O e. Y ) $.
cvmliftmoi.m $e |- ( ph -> M e. ( K Cn C ) ) $.
cvmliftmoi.n $e |- ( ph -> N e. ( K Cn C ) ) $.
cvmliftmoi.g $e |- ( ph -> ( F o. M ) = ( F o. N ) ) $.
cvmliftmoi.p $e |- ( ph -> ( M ` O ) = ( N ` O ) ) $.
cvmliftmoi $p |- ( ph -> M = N ) $.
